Well, let me tell you, folks, I’ve been watching this with a heavy heart. We’ve got people coming in from all over the world, and I’m not sure where the line is anymore. These newcomers—they bring their own customs, their own ways, and sometimes those ways don’t exactly align with what’s best for our country. I’ve seen it in the cities—queues at hospitals, schools overcrowded, and our culture being diluted. It’s not about race or religion, it’s about preserving what made this nation great in the first place.

You know, I’m all for people working hard and contributing, but when they come here and take jobs that our own citizens are desperate for, that’s a problem. I’ve heard from business owners who can’t find help because the locals don’t want to work for minimum wage, but the newcomers will. That’s not fair. And let’s not forget about crime—there are reports, real reports, showing that certain groups have higher crime rates in some areas. I’m not saying all of them, but there are patterns, and we can’t ignore them.

We need to be honest with ourselves. We can’t keep opening the doors wider and wider without thinking about the consequences. These people come here expecting everything to be handed to them, and they don’t respect our laws or our traditions. We need to take control of our borders and make sure that only those who truly want to become part of our society are allowed in. We’ve got to protect our communities, our jobs, and our way of life.
